body.p:
To his excellency Thos E Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky,

Your petitioners would respectfully recommend to your clemency Moses Weaver a Free man of Color who was indicted by a Grand jury of Woodford County for selling whiskey to slaves, and at the April Term 1863 of the Woodford Circuit Court fined in the sum of $12000 which sum they respectfully ask your honor to remit, or so much thereof as you can within your Executive powers though the act was proven against him by a slave we have every reason to believe the slave testified falsely and that Moses is innocent of the charge alledged and proven against him,

R. H. Campbell
D D Carpenter
Wm M. Morris
Daniel Boone
F. A. Davis
Thos. C. Campbell
W. W. Furr
W. T. Furr

Woodford Cir. Ct
vs
Moses Weaver
$120 -

Remit except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
